str:Codelist.com:Name: REPORTING_PERIOD_TYPE
str:Codelist.com:Description: It is used to identify and distinguish between different types of time periods in economic and financial reporting. The specific start and end dates for a fiscal year (FY) can vary depending on the country, organization, or industry. When reporting data using this codelist, it is essential to specify the exact start and end dates of the fiscal year being referenced.

str:Code.com:Name: Calendar year
str:Code.com:Description: A 12-month period starting on January 1st and ending on December 31st.

str:Code.com:Name: Fiscal year
str:Code.com:Description: A 12-month period that a company or government uses for accounting purposes. The fiscal year may or may not align with the calendar year. For example, a company's fiscal year could start on July 1st and end on June 30th of the following year.

str:Code.com:Name: Base year
str:Code.com:Description: The Base Year is a specific year chosen as a reference point for constructing an index or comparing data over time.

str:Code.com:Name: Standard reference period (SRP)
str:Code.com:Description: Standard Reference Period (SRP) is a consistent timeframe used for comparing data over time.

str:Code.com:Name: Standard reference period (2010=100)
str:Code.com:Description: Standard Reference Period (SRP) is a consistent timeframe used for comparing data over time. This series is references to 2010=100.
